items.title: UX Research PM (remote, U.S.)
items.content:
Usability studies are an Applause core service offering. As our pipeline of U.S. clients utilizing UX research services continues to expand we have a need for a UX Researcher with depth in ResearchOps. The ideal candidate will have experience in project management and consulting.

Terms:

  • Role: UX Research PM (1099 contract type)
  • Location: U.S. primarily in a remote capacity with expected 10-15% travel to client offices
  • Duration: 12 months
  • Capacity: full-time, 40 hours per week

Responsibilities:

(UX Research)

  • Defining and planning user research
  • Evangelizing user research best practices
  • Understanding various UX methodologies, including remote moderated/unmoderated and in-person
  • Supervising the quality of deliverables

(PM)

  • Managing project plans: milestones, deliverables, resources
  • Optimizing project execution and integration
  • Developing best practices for the UX program reporting
  • Applying learnings from prior efforts and assess trends in terms of execution and process
  • Influencing organizations on when Applause is the appropriate tool

Essential Skills:

  • Broad experience in qualitative research methods, especially remote and unmoderated methods
  • Proficiency in planning, scoping, conducting, analyzing and communicating research
  • Very collaborative with a demonstrated ability to work effectively in a dynamic, creative and remote environment
  • Strong relationship and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent organizational, analytical and problem solving skills
  • Solid communication and presentation skills
  • Flexibility to accommodate unplanned client and project changes

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years in a UX research role or relevant professional experience
  • 2 years of consulting experience
  • 2 years of project management experience
  • Bachelor's Degree in Human Computer Interaction, Psychology, related field or similar work experience

*Note that a UX Research portfolio submission will be required for evaluation or else the undertaking of a mock UX study for subsequent assessment.

items.title: UX Designer (USA - remote; Contract-to-Hire)
items.content:
Who We Need


We are looking for a User Experience Designer to create products that provide meaningful and relevant experiences to users. This involves the design of the entire process of acquiring and integrating the product, including aspects of systems design, interaction design, usability, and function. This role can be based anywhere in the USA and is on a contract-to-hire basis.


What You'll Do


  • Identify and explain user issues in simple terms and recommend how the user experience can be optimized

  • Ask questions, take risks and champion new ideas

  • Translate concepts into an intuitive user experience

  • Present your ideas and designs to internal teams and clients

  • Problem solve to make decisions and offer ideas to solve client issues relating to both core and new functions

  • Identify design efficiencies and elegant solutions

  • Manage your own time and maintain responsibility for completion and accuracy of work products

  • Use interaction design and usability skills to make the complex clear, while understanding how it works behind the scenes and adjusting accordingly

  • Some domestic travel required.


What You Bring To The Table


  • 5+ years of UX design experience

  • Expertise in standard UX software such as Sketch, InVision, Abstract, and Zeplin

  • Proven ability to work with clients, understand requirements, and design complete user experiences that meet client expectations

  • Firm grasp of UX/UI design best practices

  • Experience crafting user journeys, wireframing solutions, and turning high-fidelity comps into clickable prototypes

  • Excellent communication skills keeping team and client informed of processes

  • Ability to build strong team and client relationships as well as effectively pitch design concepts and articulate design decisions

items.title: Artworker / Designer
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We are looking for an artworker/designer in London to work with our multi award-winning business and help everyone talk about everywhere.


Excellent craft skills and experience of design for screens and print is necessary. The work will span brochures, advertising campaigns, app and website assets, events, graphic design for information and interaction.


The what3words platform spans a large number of industries and is used around the world, both in the developed world and in developing nations where new technology leapfrogs traditional infrastructure, and therefore the presentation of what3words needs to respect and be responsive to this breadth.


You will work in our creative team to produce partner materials /assets, social campaigns, campaign response, demos, product mock-ups, and other communication materials, to drive global adoption of 3 word addresses.


Your ability to work in a multidisciplinary team is paramount and you should be keen to stretch your skills and learn from others in pursuit of great work.


Requirements


You will have:



  • Passion for your craft and the business

  • A good knowledge of digital print processes

  • Solid experience generating digital and social media assets – particularly, online display

  • A positive, professional approach to work, acting as an ambassador for what3words and the design team

  • An ability to work independently

  • An ability to meet project deadlines


You will be:



  • Excellent Adobe CC skills – photoshop, illustrator, indesign

  • Excellent production knowledge – delivering artwork for print and web

  • A good feel for motion design and user experience

  • Deeply passionate about design and have a keen eye for detail

  • Hands on and unafraid to get stuck in



Extra credit if you:



  • Have knowledge of latest social platforms and trends

  • Have a firm grasp on best mobile practices for Apple and Android

  • Have basic motion design skills


About us


The what3words marketing team reports to the CMO and works closely with our product, technology and business development teams. The business is growing and so is the marketing team; you’ll be getting involved in almost every aspect of the business so flexibility and a willingness to muck in is essential.


The what3words team is a mix of experienced entrepreneurs, people who have worked at the highest levels in large global organisations, academics, and bright graduates – it’s a good balance, and it’s important for us that we get the right person who is happy working alongside people from all of these backgrounds, whether in the main office in West London or working remotely. We have a culture that encourages curiosity and imagination in how we achieve our goals, and an absolute focus on building a global business.


Our in-house team consists of copywriters, motion designers, art directors, UXD, social creative, and is led by an award winning Creative Director.


This is an incredibly exciting time to be joining our business, as we begin to explore new global territories. We hope in 5 years you will be proud to tell people you were one of the first at what3words.


What next


We are looking for someone to start this role as soon as possible, so applications will be considered as and when we receive them.


Please note that this role will be based in our London office, therefore we will only accept applications from individuals based in London (or ready to move to London immediately) and those that have authorisation to work in the UK.

items.title: UI/UX Design Mentor (Part-Time/Remote)
items.content:
UI/UX Design Mentor (Part-Time/Remote)

Anywhere

freelance

The Opportunity

Springboard runs an online, self-paced UI/UX Design Career Track in which participants learn with the help of a curated curriculum and 1-1 guidance from an expert mentor. Our mentor community - the biggest strength of our programs - comprises some of the best experts in the field.

If you are as passionate about mentoring as you are about UX and UI, and can give a few hours per week in return for an honorarium, we would love to hear from you.

Please reach out to us with any questions at mentors@springboard.com :-)

The Program
  • Completely online
  • Self-paced
  • Students become proficient in UI/UX with the help of a curated online curriculum, an industry design project, and project-based deliverables
  • Coursework is made up of 700+ hour expert-curated curriculum
  • On average, students finish in 9 months
  • Students are working professionals from all over the world, dedicated to switching careers into UI/UX Design
  • Students have a weekly 30-minute checkin with their mentor to discuss questions, projects, and career advice!
You:
  • Are as passionate about teaching design as about design itself
  • Are proficient in the topics covered in our UI/UX Design Career Track (we are looking for designers who have equal experience in UI and UX)
  • Have at least 5 years of relevant work experience, and a high quality portfolio to showcasing your UI and UX skills
  • Are available for weekly, 30-minute video check-ins with students to help them set and achieve learning goals, answer subject matter questions, provide feedback on projects, and offer career advice
  • Have experience critiquing work, in particular giving meaningful feedback on visual/UI design, and be able to think on your feet quickly
  • Are empathetic and have excellent communication skills
Benefits
  • Membership in a rich community of expert mentors from great companies like AirBnB, Uber, Google, and Pivotal
  • Change the lives of students in our program
  • Help us revolutionize online education!
  • Receive a monthly per-student honorarium
  • Work at your convenience

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply for this job ↬

Job description

User Research International is a research company based out of Redmond, Washington. Working with some of the biggest companies in the industry, we aim to improve your experience via paid research studies. Whether it be the latest video game or productivity tools, we value your feedback and experience. We are currently conducting a research study called Docker Study. We are looking for currently employed Full-Time Developers who use Cloud Platforms. This study is a one-time Remote Study via an online meeting. We’re offering $200 for participation in this study. Session lengths are 2 hours. These studies provide a platform for our researchers to receive feedback for an existing or upcoming products or software. We have included the survey link for the study below. Taking the survey will help determine if you fit the profile requirements. If you complete the survey, and you are actually a fit to the study's requirements, URI will follow up with you. I have summarized the study details below. In order to be considered, you must take the survey below. Thank you!

Study: Docker Study

Gratuity: $200

Session Length: 2 hours

Location: Remote via Online Connection

Dates: November. Available dates are located within the survey

Survey: Docker Study Survey

Apply now

About User Research International

We use your experience to improve upon the products you use. Whether it be the latest video game or productivity tools, we value your experience. 

Benefits

  • Paid research studies
  • Improving tech
  • Getting your feedback and experience
  • Meeting researchers working directly on the products you use

items.title: Senior UI, UX Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Senior UI, UX Designer at Elo Entertainment

Remote | Freelance

Contract

Description

At Elo Entertainment, we build products serving a wide variety of gaming communities and millions of players. We are a data focused company, committed to transforming that data into powerful personal narratives through our products. Our design team is at the heart of this effort, working daily to take complex experiences, and manifest them in accessible and meaningful products and features.

As a Senior UI/UX Designer, you will work as part of a design team responsible for the experience of our existing products and brands, as well as take ownership of working on new products and brands. You will work closely with product owners, software engineers and stakeholders in building a clear product vision, and transforming that vision into usable, functional, memorable experiences.

Elo is a fully remote company with a fully remote culture. In this aspect, we rely on each team member to be fully responsible and accountable for managing their time, working professionally and proactively with other remote team members, and valuing over communication and transparency in all activities. If you are comfortable in a fully remote environment, and excited about working on products that serve millions of gamers in an exciting, fast paced growth industry, Elo may be the right place for you.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with designers, product owners, engineers and stakeholders to define problems, map flows, prototype interactions, and create new products and services.
  • Design elegant flows and interactions for a global audience across platforms
  • Give and solicit feedback from designers and cross-disciplinary team members
  • Execute in a fast-paced environment
  • Deliver mocks and assets in a timely manner

Requirements

  • Expertise visualizing complex data in interactive environments
  • Expert knowledge of Sketch
  • Experience working with Zeplin, Invision or similar tool sets.
  • Experience working with technical and product teams, taking products from inception to launch
  • Deep knowledge of web and mobile standards and interfaces
  • Applied experience working with responsive design
  • Capable of clearly expressing vision and end state through low fidelity examples and wireframes
  • Has active interest in gaming

Benefits

Why Elo Entertainment?

  • Join an established brand, in an exciting growth industry
  • Work on something you love, learn more about the games and the communities that drive them
  • Work on experiences that serve millions of people
  • Work in visually unique space, where you will draw inspiration from unique game identities, and work to build identities that represent player communities
  • Fully remote: love where you work, live where you want

Compensation:

  • Full time renewable 6 month contract
  • Salary: 70k – 80k USD
  • Flexible work schedule & vacation policy
Apply for job

items.content:
Designer for Solar Startup at Solar Lead Factory

Remote
“…solar power will be the single largest source of electricity generation… People do not understand the magnitude of the business. It’s really very, very significant.”

-Elon Musk

Once a fringe thing hippies did, “going solar” is now going mainstream. It took over 30 years for the first 1 million solar installations to be completed. It only took another 3 years to install the second million. Over the next 2 years another 1 million homes will “go solar” and there are 90 million American households to go after that! Solar technology is cheaper, better and more reliable than ever. Unless your head is buried in a coal mine, it’s becoming abundantly clear that solar is the future.

With rapid growth & mainstream adoption comes massive investment and opportunity in the space. Installation companies are growing quickly, making them hungry for even more growth. The technology is dialed, the installation process is clean, but it’s still a challenge to find customers. Since customers that convert into sales are the lifeblood of any company, sales leads are the raw tool that unleashes massive growth for solar installers.

That’s why we built SolarLeadFactory.

About Us:

SolarLeadFactory has helped over 600,000 homeowners looking to buy solar. We have helped hundreds of solar installers grow their businesses – and aim to help thousands more.

Our business is built on a proprietary software platform allowing us to deliver a best in class product and innovate constantly. We have in-house developers, digital marketing experts & scientists relentlessly driving the product forward.

Our mission: unlock consumer demand for solar power.

About You:

You are an experienced designer who loves your work, and wants to play an instrumental role in creating beautiful customer experiences that help accelerate the adoption rate of solar power.

You are looking to fill 10-20 hours per work of design work on a long-term basis.

In order to be successful in this position you must be an excellent designer/user interface or interaction expert, as well as a problem solver, who is efficient, proactive, and an excellent communicator.

You’re looking for a way to make a huge positive difference in the world & help the companies on the front lines of the solar revolution!

You want to be part of a small but driven team making a big impact on one of the most pressing issues of our time. You share some of our core values including “Making Learning the Key Metric”, “Holding Yourself Accountable”, “Always be Testing Something,” and “Master your Craft”.

Do you want to learn? To grow? To make a difference?

Critical Skills:
  • Visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction
  • Familiarity with basic front-end languages (HTML, CSS, etc)
  • Responsive/cross-platform design skill
  • Solar experience is not required, but an interest in solar is
  • Efficient, fast-moving, doer
  • Ambition to grow
  • Problem solving, ability to find solutions, and getting things done
  • Excellent verbal & written skills
  • Ability to work with a team to find great solutions
  • Up-to-date with the latest web trends, techniques, and technologies
Your Mission:

Your job will be to help us build the best customer experience we can for homeowners who want to buy solar, as well as working to improve the look, feel, and functionality of our core tech (the lead distribution and processing application we’ve built from scratch over the last 8 years).

Weekly tasks on an ongoing basis could be anything from developing an initial design brief for the company, improving the look and feel of our user funnel, designing new landing pages, or improving the look and feel of our customer service application.

You will work directly with our current Lead Developer, operations and marketing teams and the rest of our team as needed.

What you get out of this:
  • Competitive pay
  • Results driven organization
  • Remote location – work from anywhere on a European or North American time zone with fast internet
  • Your input matters! We look for the BEST. Period.
  • Work in an amazing industry. Your friends & family will say “whoa, that’s cool!”
  • Fast-growing, fun-loving company. Get on the rocketship now!

We are shaking up our industry and working day in and day out to get solar on everyone’s roof. Come shape your future & the future of the world.

If you’re game to make a big difference and reap the rewards, come join us!

Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

items.content:
UX Designer

United Kingdom, Liverpool
Company: Forward Role

Overview

Senior UX Designer

Chester

£35,000 – £45,000

Looking on behalf of an internationally known travel company, I’m on the search for a proven UX Designer capable of assisting the Head of UX in shaping the businesses UX direction as well as being a key hands-on member of the design team.

As the acting Senior UX Designer, you will be responsible for applying a wide range of creative, technical and interactional skills to create eye-catching and usable website designs. You will be comfortable in implementing your ideas quickly and efficiently, being pivotal in improving the whole companies online customer experience.

Communication is always key and you will be expected to liaise comfortably with key stakeholders, guiding them through the end-to-end process and highlighting the benefits behind the teams’ designs.

As well as this you will be heavily involved in shaping and developing the UX team, creating a hard-working creative environment and leading by example, contributing heavily with conceptualising ideas and driving through the implementation stages to meet business objectives.

Essential to have:

  • Experience in designing e-commerce web sites in a fast-paced commercial environment.
  • Strong understanding of interaction design
  • Ability to adapt to an agile environment.
  • Sketch & prototyping experience
  • Understanding of HTML5 & CSS3 (knowing your limitations when designing for the web, not coding from scratch!)
  • Able to work closely with stakeholders and good people management.

Company benefits include:

  • 30 days holiday.
  • Senior bonus scheme.
  • Private medical.
  • Staff discount on national and international products.

Plus many more…

Interested? APPLY for email: / for more info!

As an industry leading, nationwide Marketing, Digital, Analytics, IT and Design recruitment agency, we are continually receiving new assignments to work on, so keep a close eye on our website, Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter pages for a full list of current permanent and interim opportunities as well as marketplace news and fun stuff.
Forward Role is operating as an employment agency.

Apply for job

items.title: Secret Benefits: UI/UX Designer. What's On The Outside Counts
items.content:
UI/UX Designer. What's On The Outside Counts

Whoever decided it's what's on the inside that counts failed to see that it's the outside which draws attention, and that you look at while interacting with each day. If the outside isn't appealing, then the inside never has the chance to impress.

Some sugar babies on our sugar dating site may be happy to make compromises in the looks department but we aren't. Everything we produce is exceptionally well designed, and now we're looking for your help as a UI / UX designer to do more of it.

Our design team can comfortably fit in one room... On one chair. He's very talented but extra capacity is long overdue. Across our web and mobile apps, emails, landing pages, marketing materials, and promotional website there are enough improvements and new ideas to keep a small army of designers busy but right now we're just looking for a full-time equivalent. You'll gain wide-rainging experience and see your work gradually make its way onto all aspects of our product.

Sick of having to spend your time building relationships with new clients each month, or working on a boring product that no one uses? There must be a reason why the last designer we hired is still with us 6 years later, and producing cutting edge work.

We're looking for:
  • UI / UX designer - you can be one, or both.
  • Good proficiency with Sketch and prototyping tools.
  • Ability to maintain and use UI design systems.
  • Willing to take feedback and iterate patiently.
  • Strong portfolio.

Our site's loved by millions so you'll enjoy the responsibility that comes with fashioning a UI that impacts tons of real people. We keep it fun and simple but produce high-quality work. Our talented dev team have the skills to ensure the final product matches your design. You'll be highly valued, we all appreciate good design.

We're a fun, motivated team that's entirely remote and distributed globally. Sick of that commute, or reminding the in-person team that you're still alive? Here we're all in the same position. You dictate when and where you do the work -- fit it around your life without feeling guilty.

We are looking for currently employed Full-Time Developers who use Cloud Platforms. This study is a one-time Remote Study via an online meeting. We’re offering $200 for participation in this study. Session lengths are 2 hours. These studies provide a platform for our researchers to receive feedback for an existing or upcoming products or software. We have included the survey link for the study below. Taking the survey will help determine if you fit the profile requirements. If you complete the survey, and you are actually a fit to the study's requirements, URI will follow up with you. I have summarized the study details below. In order to be considered, you must take the survey below. Thank you!

Study: Docker Study

Gratuity: $200

Session Length: 2 hours

Location: Remote via Online Connection

Dates: November. Available dates are located within the survey

Survey: Docker Study Survey

Apply now

About User Research International

We use your experience to improve upon the products you use. Whether it be the latest video game or productivity tools, we value your experience. 

Benefits

  • Paid research studies
  • Improving tech
  • Getting your feedback and experience
  • Meeting researchers working directly on the products you use

items.title: Web Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
• £22k pa

  • Permanent position starting asap

  • We welcome and encourage diverse perspectives


 


Who we are


Awesome Shoes is one of the UK’s leading online children’s footwear retailer, selling coveted international fashion and sportswear brands. Our portfolio includes some of the leading global brands in the industry such as adidas Originals, Timberland, New Balance, Converse, Kickers, Dr Martens, Havaianas, Hunter, Vans and many more.


Our mission is to make people's feet happy.


We fulfil every order from our warehouse in East London and build all our technology in-house. Our drive to be the best means we are rated #1 in shoes on Trustpilot.


We are a small team who are looking to expand in order to do more.


 


What we believe


We fundamentally believe in:



  • Crafting unique and enjoyable experiences — for our customers and colleagues alike

  • Disrupting existing assumptions and solutions, whether external or internal to the company

  • Everyone having access to the same products, experiences and opportunities as anyone else

  • Allowing and supporting everyone to reach their desired potential


 


What we're working on


We want to change the way people shop for shoes online. One of the biggest sources of anxiety when buying shoes online is knowing whether you've bought the correct size. We are working on ways to solve this problem through technology. We are also looking at how we can increase customer engagement and loyalty by providing different and interesting shopping experiences.


Efficiency is at the heart of our business. If there is a repetitive task, it can and will be automated. We have a lot of automated systems, from realtime product pricing to machine learning customer support. This has enabled us to keep our team very lean whilst still achieving growth and most importantly, customer satisfaction.


 


What you'll be working on


We want to build the ultimate website which changes the way people shop for shoes.



  • Our main purpose is to sell shoes, so you'll be designing products to browse products, seamless checkout experiences, order delivery updates and after care

  • You'll be designing and improving internal tools such as warehouse pick and dispatch applications and customer support software

  • You'll be designing marketing and promotional material to acquire and retain customers

  • There will be a lot of variety in the work and the ability to work across lots of different aspects of the business so there is a big opportunity for learning and growth


 


What we're looking for in you


From a design perspective



  • Required: Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch or Figma

  • Nice to haves: Invision or Marvel

  • Good understanding of typography, image, colour & layout

  • A keen eye for details and the desire to create a great customer experience

  • Bonus: Experience with motion design and After Effects

  • Bonus: Experience/talent in illustration

  • Previous e-commerce experience is preferred


From a human perspective



  • Be kind and empathetic to all people

  • Have integrity and conviction in doing the right thing always

  • A desire to learn and grow professionally


We don't care how many years you have been working or if you have a degree in design. We care about what you have done and what you can do.


 


What you'll get from us



  • Support to do your best work

  • 25 days holiday per year plus your birthday off

  • Discounts on shoes

  • Weekly catered lunch

  • Company pension scheme


 


The interview process


Once your application has been received the hiring process will consist of three stages:



  1. A short phone interview

  2. An at-home design exercise

  3. An on-site interview (London)


We are a small team so our focus will be on finding someone who has not only a keen eye for design but the right attitude and alignment with our beliefs as a company.


 


Your application


You should try to include as many of the following:



  • A description of your work history

  • Any online profiles you use (Dribbble, Twitter, etc)

  • Any websites/apps you've designed or help design, including any portfolio or personal website you may have

  • Any other work you feel demonstrates your abilities


None of these are a requirement but they will better inform our decision making around your application.


Thank you for reading this and we do hope you consider applying!

items.title: Game Marketing Artist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=24, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Game Marketing Artist at Highrise Virtual World

Remote

Remote

Marketing

Art

About Highrise

Highrise is a mobile game and community where people make avatars, design art and environments and meet new friends. We are building on the spirit of applications like Animal Crossing, The Sims, Habbo Hotel and Second Life.

Over 3 million people create avatars, chat and make friends in Highrise. We are a fully remote team of 20 backed by YCombinator, Bessemer, Maveron and other leading investors.

About the Role

We are looking for a game marketing artist. You will be creating videos and images to market on various advertising channels, including Facebook, Snapchat and others. This is comes with a wide variety of responsibilities: creating animated and static creative, storyboarding ad concepts, and organizing creative content and tracking performance. You’ll be working closely with our CEO, UA Manager, and our in-house art team. This job is fully remote.

This role will give you the opportunity to…

  • Design creative for major marketing platforms like Facebook, Snap, Tik Tok, and more
  • Come up with unique ideas and manifest them
  • Experiment with a wide variety of styles, formats and messages
  • Work closely with the marketing and art teams to receive direct feedback on what is and isn’t working
  • Iterate quickly and learn FAST

To be successful in this role, we’d expect you to…

  • Have 2+ years of animation experience
  • Have some art experience
  • Enjoy crafting marketing messages and storyboards
  • Spend time to understand our audience
  • Communicate effectively with both artists and marketing managers
  • Know how to accept and work with feedback
  • Iterate and learn very quickly

Within 3 months you’ll…

  • Evaluate our current creative pipeline
  • Design multiple animated creatives per week
  • Develop a feel for competitor ads
  • Develop a feel for what the Highrise audience finds compelling
  • Work closely with in-house artists to organize and use our 10,000+ art assets
  • Work closely with our marketing manager to iterate on ads based on performance

Within 6 months you’ll…

  • Develop a high performing creative pipeline
  • Continue to iterate on ads and come up with new creative concepts
  • Track ROI and other ad metrics to deeply understand performance
Apply for job

items.title: Happy Valley: Graphic Designer Wanted for Cannabis Company

items.content:
Graphic Designer Wanted for Cannabis Company

Part-time
Anywhere
Remote job
Mid-sized business
Posted Today – Accepting applications

The Graphic Designer supports the Vice President of Marketing to create effective visual solutions for both traditional and digital media, including: print, packaging, brochures, signage, website, email, mobile apps and social media content.  In addition to strong user interface and design sensibilities, experience with video editing software is also required.

Essential Job Functions

  • Ability to create deliverables that follow existing brand guidelines.
  • Retouching, color correcting, and optimizing files for digital outputs.
  • Edit videos from provided assets for output on social media and in-store use. 
  • Manage, organize and catalog a growing archive of unique photography and video assets.
  • Create print collateral from concept to finished design and printer ready files for outside printing vendor.
  • Assist with production of content for executive level client presentations - PowerPoint presentations, proposals, sales assets.

Required Knowledge and Skills

  • Minimum of 5 years experience solving design problems. 
  • Strong in UI/UX skills with demonstrated knowledge in real world applications and clients
  • Proficiency in Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, Adobe Premiere/Final Cut Pro.
  • Knowledge of web and mobile design principles and understanding/experience in front-end web design (e.g. HTML5, CSS4, JavaScript/AJAX, etc.).
  • Knowledge of Wordpress CMS, iOS and Android human interface design principles
  • Experience in email design best practices
  • Ability to operate a DSLR camera and photo editing skills
  • Extremely detail oriented with high quality/accuracy and proofreading skills;
  • Ability to work closely with developers, understanding their technical capabilities and constraints;

items.title: Design Course Mentor at Thinkful Inc.
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=19}
items.content:
Design Course Mentor

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Online Education, Web Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Thinkful Inc. | No office location

Technologies

design
user-experience
html
css
balsamiq

Job description

Who We Are 
At Thinkful, we believe that if schools put in even half the amount of effort that students do the outcomes would be better for everyone. People would have a path to a fulfilling future, instead of being buried under debt. Employers would benefit from a workforce trained for today. And education could finally offer students a return on their investment of both money and time.  We put in outlandish amounts of effort to create an education that offers our students a guaranteed return on their investment. we partner with employers to create a world-class curriculum built for today. We go to ends of the earth to find mentors who are the best of the best. We invest more in career services than any of our peers. We work hard to be on the ground in the cities our students are. Simply put, no other school works as hard for its students as we do.  Students enroll in Thinkful courses to gain the valuable technical and professional skills needed to take them from curious learners to employed technologists. As a Design Course Mentor, you will support students by acting as an advisor, counselor, and support system as they complete the course and land their first industry job. To achieve this, you will engage with students using the below range of approaches, known as Engagement Formats. Design Course Mentors are expected to provide support across all formats when needed. 

  • Mentor Sessions: Meet with students 1-on-1 in online video sessions to provide technical and professional support as the student progresses through the curriculum.
  • Group Sessions: Host online video sessions on topics of your expertise (in alignment with curriculum offerings) for groups of student seeking live support between mentor sessions. 
  • Grading: Reviewing student checkpoints submissions and delivering written feedback, including analysis of projects and portfolios. 
  • Technical Coaching: Provide in-demand support to technical questions and guidance requests that come to the Technical Coaching team through text and video in a timely manner. This team also provides the TA support for immersive programs. 
  • Assessments & Mock Interviews: Conduct 1-on-1 mock interviews and assessments via video calls and provide written feedback to students based on assessment rubrics. 

In addition to working directly with students, Design Course Mentors are expected to maintain an environment of feedback with the Educator Experience team, and to stay on top of important updates via meetings, email, and Slack. Ideal candidates for this team are highly coachable, display genuine student advocacy, and are comfortable working in a complex, rapidly changing environment.

Requirements

  • 3+ years relevant professional work experience
  • Proficiency in Visual Design, UX Design, HTML, & CSS
  • Experience using Figma, Adobe CC, Sketch, Balsamiq, and/or Invision 
  • Demonstrates genuine student advocacy and empathy for beginners
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment
  • Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection and webcam
  • Teaching, mentoring and/or coaching experience a plus 

Benefits

  • This is a part-time role (10-25 hours a week)
  • Fully remote position, with a flexible schedule  
  • Access to all of Thinkful Courses for your continued learning
  • Community of 500+ like-minded professionals looking to impact others and keep their skills sharp
  • Grow and develop as an educator with your managing Squad Lead and Squad
Apply now

About Thinkful Inc.

Thinkful is a new type of school that brings high-growth tech careers to ambitious people everywhere. The company provides 1-on-1 learning through its network of industry experts, hiring partners, and online platform to deliver a structured and flexible education. Thinkful offers programs in web development and data science, with in-person communities in up-and-coming tech hubs around the U.S. To join the Thinkful network visit thinkful.com.

Benefits

  • Join team of 500+ developers mentoring the developers of the future
  • Access to top-rated curriculum
  • Paid position
  • Flexible Schedule and Hours
  • Remote Capability

items.title: Graphic – Web Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=10}
items.content:
Graphic – Web Designer at Jibble Group

Remote | International
  • Remote Worldwide
  • Full-Time
  • Product

Job Description

About the Graphic / Web Designer position

Come join a diverse and collaborative team of engineers, product managers, marketing, sales and business professionals that is passionate about simplifying HR in South East Asia across industry segments, including retail, food & beverage, legal, hospital, manufacturing, construction, tech and others.

We’re looking for someone who can take direction from written or spoken ideas and convert them seamlessly into images, layouts and other designs. The successful candidate should have an intimate understanding of how marketing campaigns work, especially in the SaaS market, to support our digital products.

At the moment we are re-defining some of our branding assets, so you will have a big impact on our product communication from various angles including tone & voice, and metaphorical illustrations or graphics.

The majority of your time will be spent on consistently producing digital media ads for social media platforms, and revamping our website and landing pages.

  • You’ll work together with Product Managers, UX Designers & Marketers to create a unified end-to-end Customer Experience
  • Develop creative systems, style guides, and any other processes necessary to execute our brand strategy and deliver consistent brand experiences both online and offline
  • Demonstrate the ability to concept and execute compelling creative storytelling across all digital assets keeping the consumers journey in mind at all times (from initial concept through final design execution) – this includes but is not limited to emails, site assets, landing pages and retargeting banners
  • Spark fresh ideas that are infused in our culture and our products
  • Ensure the level of excellence in all creative work designed and executed, this includes supervision of retouching to ensure consistency and cohesiveness
  • Create a wide range of graphics and layouts for SaaS product illustrations, and websites with design software
  • Put together disparate elements of a design created by another professional, such as icons, photographs and other components necessary for a website design
  • Leverage a digital and mobile-first mindset in design

About you:

  • You have 2+ years experience in designing websites and graphics for digital advertising (banner, carousel, story ads)
  • You have extensive experience with design tools such as Illustrator, Photoshop, or Figma, specifically with mockups, web design and multimedia presentation
  • You have deep experience with a variety of media and custom illustrations
  • You have some experience with web and motion design (big plus!)
  • You have the ability to think at a high level about digital marketing strategy and vision
  • You’re fluent in English and possess outstanding communication skills and are able to pitch, articulate and clarify your design decisions
  • You have excellent leadership, communication and teamwork skills

As A Graphic Designer/Illustrator at Jibble you’ll get:

  • To learn and work with a lean, experienced international team who started and grew multiple tech startups
  • A competitive salary
  • To report to senior management directly
  • Experience with all sides of the business, the role is versatile and there are plenty of growth opportunities internally
  • A flexible work environment – although we have an office space, we want you to be as productive as you can be – work from anywhere you want, we care about value

About The Company

Our Mission, Vision and Values

By making the complex easy, Jibble Group is helping businesses save time and money, and unleash their human potential. Our vision is to power and empower millions of businesses with our software. Our core values include:

  • We want to build something amazing.
  • We are innovators, not emulators.
  • Whatever we do, we do it damn well.
  • It doesn’t matter where or when we work as long as we deliver.
  • We challenge conventions, we challenge each other.
  • Gaining one customer that loves us is better than gaining ten that don’t.

Our Team and Products

Jibble Group is a growth stage startup in the Workforce Management space that fully embraces remote work. We are headquartered in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, with 70+ staff in 13 different countries.

We created PayrollPanda.my and Jibble.io, founded in 2016 and 2017, respectively. PayrollPanda is Malaysia’s leading cloud payroll software, where Jibble offers a workforce management solution worldwide.

We recently raised US$2.5m at a $33m valuation, ARR (annual recurring revenue) is growing by over 300% p/a as we close in on becoming the leading HR SaaS company in South-East Asia, with 1600+ paying customers across 50+ different countries.

Apply for job

items.title: Chemistry Video Developer
items.content:
Chemistry Video Developer at Nagwa

Remote | Freelance | International | Part-time
  • Remote, Multiple Countries
  • Part Time
  • Mid Level

Job Summary

We are an innovative educational technology startup; we aim to be industry leaders in the use of video to assist teachers and their learners around the globe.

We are looking for freelance, chemistry subject matter experts who can create clear, engaging, informative, and entertaining videos in English.

You must:

  • be passionate about chemistry education
  • have a quiet recording area at your disposal
  • be able to commit a minimum of 10 hours a week (on average)

Videos are created on our Nagwa Studi app for iPad. Examples can be found here: nagwa.com/en/lessons/656187501239/.

Responsibilities:

  • Research , plan, and develop outstanding video content for chemistry in English.
  • Use your teaching experience to identify and address common misconceptions.
  • Meet Nagwa’s requirements for clarity, accuracy, quality, style, and functionality.
  • Produce memorable videos that are accessible to students with differing learning styles, from a wide range of backgrounds.
  • Receive and act upon constructive feedback through our content review process.

Qualifications & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in chemistry.
  • 2 – 5 years of experience in chemistry teaching or content development.
  • Speaks English at an idiomatic level.
  • Previous experience in educational video production is desirable, but not essential.

Essential Competencies:

  • Ability to engage students.
  • Ability to learn and grasp new concepts quickly.
  • Quality-oriented while meeting deadlines.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Strong creative and critical-thinking skills.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Flexibility and willingness to learn.
  • Positive attitude and high energy.

We pay $35/hour in the US or £25/hour in the UK, and other regions will be considered. You can choose your hours of work, up to a full-time equivalent of 35 hours per week.

Apply for job

items.title: Graphic Designer (entry level)
items.content:
We have an exciting opportunity for a Junior Graphic Designer to support our Marketing Team.


Whether you’ve just graduated or you are in a junior position, this role will allow you to gain some experience working with a start-up in London. You will create assets for website and email to support our Marketing activities. We are looking for someone with a “can do” attitude, a creative mindset and a keen eye for detail. 


Experience using Adobe Creative Suite is preferred - proficiency in Photoshop is essential.


This role will be remote and to work between 4 and 5 days per month. 


Please send a couple of sentences about yourself and any examples of your work along with your application.


 


About Live Better With


 


We are a London-based start-up that aims to make life with a long-term health condition a little easier - with helpful products, information, and a place to find your community.

Milkshake Studio is seeking an exceptionally talented Designer to join our team. As a Milkshake Designer you’ll be working within a close-knit team of designers and developers.  You will be responsible for brand concepts, user experience and wireframing, user interface design, prototyping, and creating successful products. You’ll be participating in client discussions and collaborating closely with them to realise their digital ideas. To succeed, you’ll need to be detail focused, team oriented, and someone who pushes the boundaries.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=36, embedded=0, frontend=6}
items.content:
Virtual Marketing Assistant – Website Designer at Equivity

Remote | Part-time
  • Remote job
  • Job openings

Job description

Equivity is looking for a part-time marketing professional who is proficient with all things website-related, from troubleshooting to creating to supporting clients with website strategy and design. The selected candidate will offer website support and consultation for clients in need of a new website, redesign of a current site, and well-informed suggestions for improving traffic and visibility. In addition, the selected candidate will be available to clients to troubleshoot and solve problems such as website restorations, plug-in issues, updates and theme adjustments.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience utilizing WordPress, Drupal, SquareSpace, and Wix. This person will also be proficient in eCommerce platforms, including Shopify, WooCommerce, and E-Bay integration. Technical website expertise and advanced website design and maintenance skills are also required. A strong background with CSS and advanced HTML coding, as well as front-end and back-end website development expertise will be necessary. This person will have built websites from scratch to the specifications of clients and companies across all platforms mentioned above. We are looking for somebody who has at least three years of experience specifically as a website expert.

If you are looking for a long-term role helping clients in a broad range of industries reach their marketing goals through website design and maintenance, and are the sort of self-starter who can remain highly productive while working from home, we want to hear from you!

More about our company:

Equivity provides virtual marketing support to clients, including individuals and small businesses, looking for assistance expanding their marketing reach. Marketing VAs typically assist clients on an ongoing basis by setting up, maintaining, and optimizing digital marketing campaigns. Examples of these campaigns include automated email marketing campaigns; Facebook, Instagram and Google Ads PPC campaigns; creating blogs and revising website content according to SEO guidelines; and organic social media posting. As a virtual marketing assistant with Equivity, you will have the opportunity to work with a variety of clients to achieve their marketing goals.

As a virtual marketing assistant with Equivity, you will have the opportunity to build a portfolio of different clients, with whom you would work to achieve their marketing goals. Our virtual assistants work with a high degree of autonomy and are responsible for developing relationships with our clients. Because we provide extremely attentive service to our clients, you must be available to respond to client communications during business hours within one hour by email, phone, and text and be available to work on projects during the business day. All of this work is done remotely, meaning that you can work from home.

The selected candidate would be hired as a part-time employee of Equivity, not an independent contractor. We are looking for somebody who has at least 20 hours per week of availability, and the starting pay is $19.00 per hour. We are a growing business and are looking for a digital marketer who is excited to partner with us and is interested in a long-term role with our company.

Qualities we are looking for:

  • Organization
  • Dedication
  • Initiative
  • Reliability
  • Attention to detail
  • Resourcefulness
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Responsiveness
  • Ability to work independently with limited oversight

Requirements

Position requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 3+ years of experience in a website designer or website manager role
  • Experience with WordPress, Drupal, SquareSpace and Wix
  • Experience with e-Commerce tools such as Shopify, WooCommerce and E-Bay integration
  • Experience designing and maintaining websites
  • Technical website design and advanced troubleshooting skills
  • CSS background and advanced HTML coding background
  • Ability to design a website from scratch, top to bottom
  • Availability to respond to requests within an hour during the hours of 9 AM – 6 PM, Monday – Friday
  • Your own laptop and smart phone with broadband access to Internet
  • Quiet location in which to take phone calls
Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
UI/UX Designer

Full-time
Richmond, VA
Remote job
Studio
Posted Today – Accepting applications
We are looking for a thoughtful, detail-oriented designer to be the next member of our growing developer-owned, remote-friendly, people-first, hyphen-loving company. 

 
Candidates need to have experience designing for screens and building components and layouts for the web. The ideal candidate would be eager to collaborate on a growing team with plenty of opportunities for shaping their own role.
 
If you have experience designing production web applications and are passionate about collaborating with clients and teammates, then we want to talk!
 
Skills & Requirements
  • Loves to work directly with customers to solve business problems
  • Experience and comfort with some UX design practices and deliverables
  • Experience designing production web applications
  • Comfort with design, UI and prototyping tools (Sketch, Adobe Suite, inVision, Zepelin, and/or Figma)
  • Considerable experience with HTML/CSS/JavaScript
 
Nice-to-haves
  • Being within easy driving distance of Richmond or Charlottesville is a HUGE plus!
  • Experience and comfort across the spectrum of UX research and design practices
  • Comfort with accessibility
  • Comfortable contributing code in varied templating languages and systems
  • Experience with front-end JavaScript frameworks
  • Comfort with version control (github)
  • Public portfolio
  • Experience creating high fidelity mockups
  • Ready to advise project teams on design principles, usability and interactions
  • Ready to consult with project owners and end users to identify application requirements
 
Passion for at least a few of the following items
  • Typography
  • Animation
  • Writing
  • Atomic design
  • Component/pattern libraries and style guides
  • Flexbox and grid
  • Whatever is on the bleeding edge of CSS
  • Accessibility
  • Clickable Prototypes
  • User-centered design methods and techniques
  • User research
  • User testing
  • Growing a product design team
 
What We Offer
  • A Great Team - Our team of engineers and designers is the best part of working here. We only hire people who are fantastic teammates – competent and smart, sure, but also humble, positive, and generous.
  • Great Clients - We work with mostly small and medium clients, for whom our projects make a huge impact. We prioritize clients who are pleasant and good to work with, people who share our values of transparency and empathy.
  • Work From Home - We are a distributed company. Everyone works from home, though the leadership team all live in central Virginia.
  • Negligible Travel - In general, we don’t travel routinely for projects. If this is a specific concern, we’re happy to discuss.
  • Flexible Work Schedule - We require a certain amount of overlap with the rest of the team, but if you have a predictable schedule, we can probably support it, e.g., ending at 3:30 every day or being out every Friday morning.
  • Good Work Life Balance (really) - We ask our team to work 40 hours a week*. That’s all: a good, productive 40 hours. And then we try our best to leave you alone off the clock. We do this in part because that’s how we want to live but also because we want our team to be recharged and ready to do their best when working. *If you need to work fewer than 40 hours, that might be possible too; let’s talk.
  • Competitive Compensation - We offer highly competitive salary and benefits, including generous time off, 401k, FSA, medical and dental insurance.

items.title: Proofread/Edit a 2000 Word Article about Branding/Graphic Design
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Proofread/Edit a 2000 Word Article about Branding/Graphic Design

Company: Logo Coast
Location: Remotely
Job Type: Freelance
Description

Hi, I'm looking to connect with a professional writer. I previously worked with another writer who created a bunch of articles for my logo/graphic design blog. The articles are pretty good, but they always have room for improvement.

Overall I tend to strive for:
- Professional (yet personable)
- Informative
- Relatable
- Easy to Read

To get a feel for my preferred writing style/voice, please check one of the currently published articles here - https://logocoast.com/blog/top-ten-tips-create-tagline/

You will have the freedom to revise the article however you see fit. Feel free to remove/rework sentences or even entire paragraphs, improve grammar, etc. As long as the article is to the point and reads well, that's all that matters.

Below I'm attaching 2 paragraphs from an article I have available. If you'd be willing to provide a quick sample, this is the best way for me to determine who is a great fit for this project. The article is about Gradient Design.

-----

Gradients took the design world by storm in the 90’s, but they still have a place in modern design. Not all designs will look great with gradient design, however, using gradients can be a great way to enhance flat designs. It’s also a great way to add color or texture to an image.

Using gradient design works better for specific kinds of brands so we wanted to share with you some of our favorite gradient designs and talk about why these designs work for these particular brands. If your brand has a similar aesthetic or these designs appeal to you, you might want to consider asking your designer for gradient design elements in your logo design or other graphic design elements for your marketing materials.

------

Please bid for just (1) 2000 word article, but also note how much you would charge for a larger order (for example, 10 articles). All of the articles I have available for editing are all right around 2000 words. I'm not worried about the final word count. If some of these articles benefit from removing some of the "fluff" that's totally fine and welcomed.

Please feel free to ask me any questions and I'd be happy to discuss further.

Thank you!

items.content:
Unnamed Seed Stage Startup | Founding Engineer OR Founding Design/Product Role | Remote and Bay Area | Full Time

We are a new startup in the UX design tool space, with a mission to radically lower the barriers needed to build full-fidelity prototypes and products, and bridging the design-engineering gap. The stage is very early, pre-product, but we have enthusiastic early feedback.

The team of four has three ex-founders. We've previously built startups where we've hired over 100 roles, sold to 20% of F500s, raised over $45mm in aggregate, gotten the businesses acquired, and built/ran teams of engineers from MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Google, FB, YC, MSR.

We received strong funding offers from a number of top tier VCs. We’re lucky to be working with a senior GP at our lead investor, along with a number of esteemed angels/funds, including well-known leaders in the design community.

We're looking for two more individuals:

- Founding generalist engineer. No particular tech specialization necessary (we use Typescript and React), but we’re ideally looking for a product-oriented engineer who has deep frontend experience.

- Founding design/product role - someone who has worked in a few different orgs (esp. the big product tech companies with strong design), knows their design tools, is interested in or has done product work, and has an extensive network of designers / can wear the evangelist hat.

In either role, you would be directly shaping everything from product direction to team to culture.

If interested, please drop us a line ASAP at designtoolstartup@googlegroups.com. Thanks, we're excited to hear from you!

items.content:
Here at Situ we are creating imaginative places set to change how people discover innovative products and services from the world’s leading brands.


We are just at the start of our journey and the path ahead will be exhilarating as we get ready to open our first venue in central London.


Our tech team who are creating our inspiring platform need some additional support and so we are now looking for a home-based UX/UI designer who lives within commutable distance of the Manchester area.  The role is permanent but contract may be considered for the right candidate.


The ideal candidate is someone who can turn our ideas into intuitive and easy to use applications that provide relevant experiences to users. This person will be involved in the entire process of design from branding, usability and function. They will be required to design the UX/UI for native mobile applications as well as responsive web applications including UI elements such as menus, tables and other popular UI elements.


Requirements:



  • Be a team player who works well in an agile team environment

  • Can work closely with designers and developers

  • Gather requirements for interfaces

  • Design flows, wireframes and prototypes for the team

  • Identify and solve UX issues, for example, responsive UIs

  • Keep up to date with industry standards


Essential experience:



  • Proven examples of UI/UX projects

  • Knowledge of wireframe/prototyping tools

  • Knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator and other design tools

  • Portfolio of existing work

  • Understanding of responsive websites

  • Experience with working in an agile environment


If this all sounds exciting and you feel ready for the challenge of joining a start-up organisation, then we would be delighted to receive your cv.

items.title: Graphic Designer
items.content:
We are Ultimate Football Fan and we represent some of the biggest names in Football Fan influeners. We create social content, documentaries and are the team behind Blud Bruvvas the show that lets the fans take the field and do their talking on the pitch. 


We are looking for a talented designer to work on ad-hoc basis creating sales decks for our reality shows, bespoke content documentaries and other football related content.     



  •  Telling a visual story, and creating fantastic look and feel for brands, using our content or   football related material 

  • Creating great mood decks

  • Creating decks that incorporate data and heavy detail that is still visually interesting and easy to understand

  • Creating design concepts for business and internal use

  • Contributing to the copy within the deck

  • Experience creating material for pitching concepts and ideas

items.content:
We are an international team of lawyers and technologists, working to reinvent the startup law experience from the ground up. Clara graduated from Techstars Dubai’s class of 2019 and closed a USD 2,000,000 seed round before expanding into London. We move fast (but thoughtfully), and are looking for a talented and impact-oriented UX/UI Designer to join us.


As part of a startup, your responsibilities will vary, but on a day to day basis, you will:



  • Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes for a wide range of devices and interfaces that lead to intuitive user experiences and effectively communicate interaction and design ideas

  • Collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience

  • Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders

  • Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core and new functions and features.

  • Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.

  • Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering

  • Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards


We are looking for someone who: 



  • shares our philosophy; 

  • is capable and excited about the role; 

  • strives for personal and professional excellence; 

  • and wants to make a meaningful difference through their work. 


The opportunity is for you if you have:



  • Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role with a portfolio of design projects

  • Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, OmniGraffle, or other visual design and wire-framing tools as well as standard UX software such as Figma, Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer, and the like is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.

  • Ability to work effectively in a remote team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.

  • Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.

  • BS/MS in Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, or related

  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum/Kanban development process

  • A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.

  • Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.

  • Up-to-date with the latest UI/UX trends, techniques, and technologies


Minimum Requirements:



  • At least 5 years of UI/UX experience in a well known software environment

  • BSc in Design, Computer Science or relevant field

  • Must be fluent (written/spoken) in English.

  • Solid oral, written, presentation and interpersonal communication skills.

  • Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for data driven software functionality

items.title: UI/UX Designer
items.content:
Finding funding for scientific research and completing the necessary applications is time-consuming. Hiring in this industry is difficult largely due to the high degree of specialisation for projects. Founded and shaped by scientists, Lit Lab gives researchers the resources that they need to do great work, helping to fund research and find talent. 


We’re looking for a UX/UI designer to build the interface for our web app. This can built remotely while maintaining a dialogue with the founding team. The chosen candidate will receive £2000 upon completion of the project. Performance will be evaluated and the opportunity to join the company for a proportion of equity may be offered. 


Currently Lit Lab has demoed a prototype to a lab with a research focus on cancer genetics, this validated the idea indicating that we’re trying to solve a compelling problem. We’ve started work on the back end of the site and are looking to have something fully-functional by the end of the year. This is an exciting opportunity to work for a startup looking to advance scientific research. Anybody that wants to do meaningful work and create a truly awesome product should apply.

items.content:
Rich Clicks is a fast-growing award-winning digital marketing company based in London specialized in the Italian and also European markets.


What are we looking for in an applicant?


We are looking for one creative, smart and autonomous Front End Designer (possibly Italian Speaker)


We’re looking for an innovator, a multi-talented person who can help us in one of the essential areas of our business. We're looking for a Junior / Middle level of experience so 1/2 years ideally.


So what does the role actually involve?



  • Front End design on various platform: Wordpress, Shopify, Unbounce, etc.



  • Create creative visual concepts and ideas forBanners, Landing Pages, Email Marketing, etc.

  • Landing Page Design, using various platforms such as Sharpspring, Unbounce, Leadpages or even custom HTML.

  • Learn how to design on our Marketing Automation Platform for Landing pages, Newsletters, mini-websites.

  • Managing projects and ongoing activities with precision and reliability.

  • Work in close relationship with the Digital Marketing Consultants and our Senior Web Developer.


Required Education, Skills and Qualifications



  • Good knowledge of HTML, CSS and Javascript

  • Attention to details, even the smallest ones (this is very important)

  • Working following a methodology.

  • Multi-project ability, time-management, and forward planning.

  • Capability to take accountability of the tasks and propose solutions design-wise.

  • Curiosity, willing to learn and being updated.


Something More About Us:



  • We're a team of 16 people, mostly Italians, close and friendly but also very well organized.

  • We follow an AGILE/SCRUM Methodology to plan our weeks in advance.

  • We'll give you one more day off for every year you work with us.

  • We give the possibility to work from home when necessary

  • We have free coffee/tea at the office, a truly authentic Italian espresso coffee :)

  • We offer a Birthday day off because we think that you should celebrate instead of working.



  • We often organize internal and external training

  • We like to be transparent and you'll work in an open office with the team and the founders.

  • We organize Fun Fridays!

  • We are RichClicks and we are innovators!


As a part of the hiring process, your knowledge will be tested during the interviews and we require a portfolio.


Salary


The Salary range is not shown because we would keep the position open to who has more seniority, we'd like to evaluate your experience and then make a proposal that could reward your experience.

items.content:
DESCRIPTION


We're a VC-backed digital insurer of the future. We use machine learning, automation, our own technology stack and comprehensive data integrations to be quicker, cheaper and fairer to customers, and are looking for a graphic designer to communicate a fresh approach - to both our customers and potential employees.


We're a team of 35 with experience at the likes of Intercom, Monzo, Transferwise, Depop, backed by investors who have backed Spotify, Monzo, Adyen and others. Over the next 2 years we will grow the team to 150, as we expand our revenue product offering and geography - pushing further in to the multi-trillion $ insurance market.


THE ROLE


As a Graphic Designer, you will be working with our senior management team, marketing and HR to present an online image of Marshmallow that enthuses customers and prospective employees about Marshmallow's mission.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Conceptualising & designing Marshmallow's brand image for both customers and prospective empolyees

  • Define Marshmallow's presence on the web

  • Inspire potential customers & promote our brand image across marketing content & advertising across digital & print

  • Continue to build the relationship with our customers by leading on customer facing communications & assets

  • Work closely with customer operations, design & product teams

  • Manage multiple briefs and organise your time effectively and independently

  • Develop and present ideas for stakeholders and the wider team to see

  • Define brand guidelines across all mediums


REQUIREMENTS



  • 1+ commercial experience

  • Strong visual aesthetic with high level of finished product demonstrating understanding of quality communication design

  • Strong communication skills both in your work and your character

  • Multidiscipline approach - able to work across multiple medium

  • Passion for the details, output and application of your work

  • Someone with strong organisational skills, taking the initiative

  • Confident ability using a range of creative tooling including: Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign


Bonus skills



  • Understanding of CSS3, HTML5 & Javascript (jQuery or similar)

  • Animation using After Effects, CSS animations or similar

  • Video editing experience


WHO WILL YOU BE WORKING WITH


Closely with our lead product designer, and the designer who has been managing brand thus far......Jason: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jsnford/


CULTURE


https://www.notion.so/getmarshmallow/Company-Values-e798b5c1fce54e8789274cf83c978831


BENEFITS



  • Competitive salary 

  • Stock options 

  • Working from home 

  • Monthly Socials 

  • 32 day holiday allowance (inc bank holidays) 

  • Pension 

  • Cycle to work scheme 

  • Unlimited books 

  • Equipment you need to get the job done 

  • Weekly knowledge sharing presentations 

  • Friday all-hands with snacks 

  • Learning and training supported 

  • Fruit, snacks and soft drinks in the office 

  • Health insurance 


INTERVIEW PROCESS


1) 30-45 minute phone call


2) Design task where we ask you to design something specific and ask for your 'process' (task should take 2-4 hours)


3) On-site

items.content:
Motorway is reinventing how cars are bought and sold online. Our mission is to bring the car industry into the future through ground-breaking products and best in class design.


In 2017 we launched the first comparison website for selling your car. With a few taps, customers can compare live offers for their car, select the best deal and sell within 24 hours. Since then we have grown significantly and recently launched Motorway Pro, a platform for dealers to search and buy cars online.


We are now looking for a talented Visual Designer to help create the next phase of Motorway’s journey.


About the role


As part of a four-person design team, you’ll be responsible for creating design work across the business, including:



  • Advertising creatives for offline and out-of-home campaigns

  • Emails, banners, videos and widgets to support our online marketing, content, social media and CRM campaigns

  • Branded merchandise and clothing

  • Illustrations and icon design

  • UI design and page layouts for our digital products and websites

  • Signage, branding and interior design for our offices in Brighton and London

  • Lots of other top secret features and projects we’re working on but can’t talk about publicly


You’ll create design work for our consumer brand (motorway.co.uk) and our Pro brand used by car dealers (pro.motorway.co.uk).


What we’re looking for



  • Some commercial experience in a design role or internship, demonstrated by a strong portfolio. 

  • An ability to solve real problems through design, demonstrated by examples of projects or features that have had a measurable impact on the business or organisation

  • Strong aesthetic ability and visual taste, resulting in work that is powerful and beautiful to behold. 

  • Typography, colour, illustration, photography, icons, branding… you are all over this

  • An exceptional eye for detail and a precise, accurate approach to creating design work

  • Experience with design tools such as Adobe CC and Sketch, and collaboration tools like Dropbox and Slack, plus strong Mac skills

  • Comfortable collaborating with different areas of the business, such as commercial, marketing or development teams

  • A personal interest and passion for visual creativity, be it art, product design, graphic design or photography

  • Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills

  • A friendly, positive personality with a willingness to work hard and as part of a team

  • Ambition to develop and be the best at what you do


What we offer



  • A competitive salary and equity package

  • The chance to join a rapidly growing company that cares first and foremost about its people

  • The chance to work with an experienced entrepreneurial team, with a big vision

  • Fast career progression and the ability to develop your own skills and experience quickly

  • Flexible working, with the option to work from home or remotely some of the time

  • Enhanced Maternity/Paternity leave that increases with tenure

  • Regular social events

items.content:
About us

At TransferGo we are on a mission to make moving money globally as simple and easy as sending a text. We aim to make life easier for anyone sending money abroad by removing the processes and fees that traditional banking institutions have.

We are a fast growing FinTech company with an international team of more than 150 employees, great product and a service available in 47 countries, with the goal to provide the best customer service every step of the way.

About the Role

Our team is in search of a Visual Designer to help us spread the TransferGo message across the world with engaging visuals. This person will be a crucial part of the Marketing Department located in London and will work closely with the Design Director and the other designers in the team.

This role offers the opportunity to be fully involved in the strategy and production of marketing and brand initiatives, as well as the chance to design visual outputs across a wide range of media.

What you’ll do:



  • Help to create and maintain a consistent visual brand across all our marketing channels.

  • Strategise and design visuals for multiple channels and media (digital, social media, web, OOH, print, tv).

  • Collaborate with multiple stakeholders across the whole organisation.


Requirements

What you’ll bring:



  • 3+ years of design experience in a brand, marketing or agency environment.

  • Fluency across graphic design, typography, illustration, and photography.

  • Ability to produce quality work under tight deadlines and to juggle across multiple projects.

  • Proactivity and problem-solving attitude, ideas that challenge the ordinary, together with the drive –­ and the guts – to bring them to life.

  • ‘Here to help’ attitude and the belief that working in a team is much better than doing it alone - even when it requires giving and receiving feedback.

  • A portfolio of past work samples and the process behind them.

  • +1 if you have experience:

    • In creating original Illustration and/or animations;

    • In video recording/editing;

    • In web design and/or coding;

    • With creative writing.




Benefits



  • Being part of extremely exciting and growing Fintech startup community.

  • Competitive salary package.

  • Flexible working hours with opportunity to work from home.

  • Opportunity to learn with a company that is rapidly growing along with a guaranteed training budget.

  • Friendly atmosphere and stimulating environment (pet friendly office, team events, snacks and drinks in the office, team buildings, fun budgets and events).

  • Gym membership.

  • Pension Scheme.
